item.description: Intro Back in the days - believe it or not - there was no YouTube, Spotify, Shazam, etc. Your only chance to find out “What’s that great song you’ve just heard on the radio was?” was: host said it’s name after it was played, you remembered the name when host it before it was played, you were with a friend that knew this song title and author It was in the end of 80’s, when tuners with digital screens become available on the market and radio stations started to transmit song authors and titles via radio waves.
